greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: List of integer-valued contraharmonic means (u^2+v^2)/(u+v) of two positive integers u and v (with u < v) ordered by increasing u and increasing v (u = 2, 3, 4, ...; v = u+1, u+2, ...).
comment: Any number a(n) is also a hypotenuse number A009003 (and conversely) - see Pahikkala 2010, Theorem 5.
link: Jussi Pahikkala, On contraharmonic mean and Pythagorean triples, Elemente der Mathematik, 65:2 (2010), 62-67.
formula: The contraharmonic mean of u and v is (u^2+v^2)/(u+v).
maple: for u from 1 to K-1 do for v from u+1 to 2*u^2-u do
od: od: t1; # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 20 2011
xref: After sorting and removing duplicates we get A009003. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 20 2011
results.author: _Pahikkala Jussi_, Nov 04 2008
ext: Minor edits by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 20 2011
